name: Iván Fischer conducts the Budapest Festival Orchestra

location.name: Koerner Hall, Royal Conservatory of Music

description:
Performing alongsside mezzo-soprano Gerhild Romberger, the Toronto Mendelssohn Choir, and the Toronto Children's Chorus.

Hungary's finest cultural ambassadors bring us Mahler's monumental Symphony No. 3 for orchestra, mezzo-soprano, women's choir, and children's choir.

Founded by Iván Fischer in 1983, the Budapest Festival Orchestra is rated among the top 10 orchestras in the world, regularly performing at the most important concert venues of the international music scene. They have won two Gramophone Awards and are Grammy-nominated. Recipients of the Association of Music Critics of Argentina's award for Best Foreign Symphony Orchestra in 2016, as well as the the Diapason d'Or for its recording of Mahler's Symphony No. 5 in 2014, and the Italian Toblacher Komponierhäuschen Prize.

name: Beginner Winter Tree Tour at Warden Hilltop Community Centre Park
description:
Join us for a beginner-friendly winter tour at Warden Hilltop CC Park, focused on the basics of identifying trees in winter. We'll explore features like bark, branch pattern and shape, helping you build confidence in winter ID. You'll also learn how these trees fit into the broader ecology of Toronto's urban forest. This relaxed walk is perfect for those new to tree identification or curious about how much the winter landscape can reveal once you know what to look for.

This tour will have both inside and outside components. Please dress according to the weather to stay warm and prepare for uneven and slippery terrain. Tour distances will range from 1 – 5 km. 

Space is limited. Please register in advance at greentoronto@toronto.ca. Include the name of the tour you would like to attend and the number of attendees. 

Contact greentoronto@toronto.ca for information on site conditions, and accessibility. If you would like to request accessibility support, contact us as soon as possible.

name: Rebirth: The Quiet Becoming Installation at Fort York
description: Experience "Rebirth: The Quiet Becoming", a bold new outdoor installation on the Gardiner Expressway beside Fort York Visitor Centre. Created by artists Delali Cofie and Yuma Dean Hester, it reimagines the site's layered histories through contemporary art. An accompanying exhibition inside the Visitor Centre deepens the experience, inviting visitors to encounter the Fort as a living cultural landscape shaped by reflection, dialogue, and collaboration.
